text: Olesya Nikolaevna Zykina (, born October 7, 1980 in Kaluga) is a Russian athlete who mainly competes in the 400 metres. In addition to winning medals in individual contests, she has been a very successful relay runner, winning the silver medal at the 2004 Olympics. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1998 |rowspan=2|World Junior Championships |rowspan=2|Annecy, France |8th |100m |11.88 (wind: +1.7 m/s) |- |bgcolor=silver|2nd |4×400m relay |3:32.35 |- |rowspan=4|2001 |rowspan=2|World Indoor Championships |rowspan=2|Lisboa, Portugal |bgcolor="CC9966" align="center" | 3rd |400 m |51.71 |- |bgcolor="gold" align="center" | 1st |4 × 400 m relay |3:30.00 |- |rowspan=2|World Championships |rowspan=2|Edmonton, Canada |align="center" | 6th |400 m |50.93 |- |bgcolor="CC9966" align="center" | 3rd |4 × 400 m relay |3:24.92 |- |rowspan=3|2002 |rowspan=2|European Championships |rowspan=2|Munich, Germany |bgcolor="gold" align="center" | 1st |400 m |50.45 |- |bgcolor="silver" align="center" | 2nd |4 × 400 m relay |3:25.59 |- |World Cup |Madrid, Spain |bgcolor="CC9966" align="center" | 3rd |400 m |50.67 |- |rowspan=4|2003 |World Indoor Championships |Birmingham, UK |bgcolor="gold" align="center" | 1st |4 × 400 m relay |3:28.45 |- |rowspan=2|World Championships |rowspan=2|Paris, France |align="center" | 6th |400 m |50.59 |- |bgcolor="silver" align="center" | 2nd |4 × 400 m relay |3:22.91 |- |World Athletics Final |Monte Carlo, Monaco |align="center" | 5th |400 m |51.81 |- |2004 |Summer Olympics |Athens, Greece |bgcolor="silver" align="center" | 2nd |4 × 400 m relay |3:20.16 |- |2005 |World Championships |Helsinki, Finland |align="center" | 6th |400 m |51.24 |- |2007 |European Indoor Championships |Birmingham, England |bgcolor="CC9966" align="center" | 3rd |400 m |51.69 |} ===Personal bests=== * 100 metres - 11.84 s (1998) * 200 metres - 22.55 s (2005) * 400 metres - 50.15 s (2001) ==External links== * Category:1980 births Category:Living people Category:Russian female sprinters Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2000 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2004 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Russia Category:Olympic silver medalists for Russia Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Russia Category:Sportspeople from Kaluga Category:World Athletics Championships medalists Category:European Athletics Championships medalists Category:Medalists at the 2004 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 2000 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic silver medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Olympic bronze medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:World Athletics Indoor Championships winners Category:World Athletics Indoor Championships medalists Category:World Athletics Championships winners
title: Olesya Zykina
